content:
I'm working to set up a project board to organize potential topics: https://github.com/orgs/rust-lang/projects/18

If you have your own ideas of topics to see at future CTCFTs, do create an issue! https://github.com/rust-lang/ctcft/issues
Here is the tracking PR for the February meetup: https://github.com/rust-lang/ctcft/pull/21
Thanks @Forest Anderson [he/him] -- my feeling is that the theme here should be sort of "2022 planning", i.e., trying to gather data and thoughts about what to focus on this year.
I definitely think that the survey stuff fits well in that theme
There's been a bit of lang team discussion on this topic lately as well, there might be something to present there (@Josh Triplett )
@rylev @Nick Cameron just want to check, would one or both of you be able to give an overview of the Rust 2021 Survey at the next CTCFT? https://github.com/rust-lang/ctcft/issues/13
This is the planned time for it: https://everytimezone.com/s/820f8d47
I should be able to. I think Ryan will be away for the next week so might not reply
Also @pnkfelix @nikomatsakis, would a talk about debuggers be good for February? https://github.com/rust-lang/ctcft/issues/20
I'm always happy to try to pitch rr and pernos.co at people. :)

Actually, change of plans, instead of the debugger talk this month, we think that an overview of the compiler team's ambitions for 2022 might fit better with February's theme. @pnkfelix @Wesley Wiser would this work for you?
Also, @Josh Triplett, I was thinking that we could be working towards a "combined" lang/compiler/libs/maybe-more roadmap discussion for March

We had a planning meeting yesterday and formed a kind of tentative plan for themes. This gets less and less certain as the months go out. You can see the sketch on the planning board.

For February the theme is planning for 2022. @Nick Cameron will discuss the Rust 2021 Survey Results, @tmandry will (hopefully) talk about async working group update, and @pnkfelix / @Wesley Wiser will (hopefully) talk about compiler team ambitions.

If there are other teams or working groups who have related content they might like to discuss, let us know. We'd like to avoid overscheduling but there is likely room for smaller, lightning-talk-style updates.
The March theme is similar, combining "inputs" into planning (discussions about what are blocking in various areas) with tentative plans that are being formed.

Forest Anderson [he/him] said:

This is the planned time for it: https://everytimezone.com/s/820f8d47

BTW: zulip can do this mapping for us: 2022-02-21T15:00:00-05:00
Thanks, I've seen this on Discord, but I'll have to give it a go here :)

https://twitter.com/RustCTCFT/status/1495749721129992194

The February CTCFT is starting in just under 7 hours! We're doing a NA-friendly meeting time today, it will be starting at 20:00 GMT/UTC+0. See you there! https://rust-lang.github.io/ctcft/meetings/2022-02-21.html

- Rust Cross Team Collaboration Fun Times (@RustCTCFT)
